28.en: 14And he said unto her, What form is he of? And she said, An old man cometh up; and he is covered with a mantle. And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he stooped with his face to the ground, and bowed himself.
28.lv: 14 Un viņš tai sacīja, Kāda veida viņš ir? Un viņa sacīja, Uznāk vecs vīrietis; un viņš ir apsegts ar apmetni. Un Sauls nomanīja, ka tas bija Samuēls, un viņš noliecās ar savu seju pie zemes un paklanījās.

28.en: 15And Samuel said to Saul, Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up? And Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.
28.lv:
15

Un Samuēls sacīja Saulam, Kāpēc tu mani traucēji mani uzvest? Un Sauls atbildēja, Es esmu gauži spaidos; jo filistieši karo pret mani, un Dievs ir aizgājis no manis un vairs man neatbild nedz caur praviešiem, ne caur sapņiem: tāpēc es tevi aicināju, lai tu man vari darīt zināmu, ko man būs darīt.

28.en: 16Then said Samuel, Wherefore then dost thou ask of me, seeing the LORD is departed from thee, and is become thine enemy?
28.lv: 16 Tad Samuēls sacīja, Kādēļ tu prasi no manis, jo tas KUNGS ir aizgājis no tevis un ir kļuvis par tavu ienaidnieku?

28.en: 17And the LORD hath done to him, as he spake by me: for the LORD hath rent the kingdom out of thine hand, and given it to thy neighbour, even to David:
28.lv: 17 Un tas KUNGS ir darījis viņam, kā viņš runāja caur mani: jo tas KUNGS ir noplēsis valstību no tavas rokas un to devis tavam tuvākajam, proti, Dāvidam:

28.en: 18Because thou obeyedst not the voice of the LORD, nor executedst his fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath the LORD done this thing unto thee this day.
28.lv: 18 Tāpēc ka tu nepaklausīji tā KUNGA balsi un neizpildīji viņa nikno bardzību uz Amaleka, tāpēc tas KUNGS šajā dienā tev šo ir darījis.

28.en: 19Moreover the LORD will also deliver Israel with thee into the hand of the Philistines: and to morrow shalt thou and thy sons be with me: the LORD also shall deliver the host of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.
28.lv: 19 Turklāt arī tas KUNGS Israēlu kopā ar tevi nodos filistiešu rokās: un rīt tu un tavi dēli būsiet pie manis: tas KUNGS arī Israēla karapulku nodos filistiešu rokā.

28.en: 20Then Saul fell straightway all along on the earth, and was sore afraid, because of the words of Samuel: and there was no strength in him; for he had eaten no bread all the day, nor all the night.
28.lv: 20 Tad Sauls nekavējoties krita uz zemes un gauži baidījās Samuēla vārdu dēļ: un viņā nebija stipruma; jo viņš nebija ēdis maizi ne visu dienu, ne visu nakti.

28.en: 21And the woman came unto Saul, and saw that he was sore troubled, and said unto him, Behold, thine handmaid hath obeyed thy voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have hearkened unto thy words which thou spakest unto me.
28.lv: 21 Un tā sieviete nāca pie Saula un redzēja, ka viņš bija gauži iztrūcināts, un viņam sacīja, Lūk, tava kalpone ir paklausījusi tavu balsi, un es esmu likusi savu dzīvību savā rokā un esmu uzklausīju tavus vārdus, ko tu man runāji.

28.en: 22Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thine handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way.
28.lv: 22 Tad nu, es tevi lūdzu, uzklausi arī tu savas kalpones balsi un ļauj man likt tavā priekšā maizes kumosu; un ēd, lai tev var būt stiprums, kad tu ej savā ceļā.

28.en: 23But he refused, and said, I will not eat. But his servants, together with the woman, compelled him; and he hearkened unto their voice. So he arose from the earth, and sat upon the bed.
28.lv: 23 Bet viņš atteicās un sacīja, Es neēdīšu. Bet viņa kalpi kopā ar to sievieti spieda viņu; un viņš uzklausīja viņu balsi. Tā viņš piecēlās no zemes un apsēdās uz gultas.

28.en: 24And the woman had a fat calf in the house; and she hasted, and killed it, and took flour, and kneaded it, and did bake unleavened bread thereof:
28.lv: 24 Un tai sievietei namā bija trekns teļš; un viņa steidzās un to nokāva, un ņēma miltus, un izmīcīja, un cepa no tiem neraudzētu maizi:

28.en: 25And she brought it before Saul, and before his servants; and they did eat. Then they rose up, and went away that night.
28.lv: 25 Un viņa to nesa Saula priekšā un viņa kalpu priekšā; un tie ēda. Tad viņi cēlās un aizgāja tajā naktī.

29.en: 1Now the Philistines gathered together all their armies to Aphek: and the Israelites pitched by a fountain which is in Jezreel.
29.lv: 1 Tad nu filistieši sapulcēja kopā visas savas armijas uz Afeku: un israēlieši apmetās pie avota, kas ir Jezreēlā.

29.en: 2And the lords of the Philistines passed on by hundreds, and by thousands: but David and his men passed on in the rereward with Achish.
29.lv: 2 Un filistiešu kungi gāja uz priekšu pa simtiem un tūkstošiem: bet Dāvids un viņa vīrieši gāja uz priekšu pakaļgalā kopā ar Ahišu.

29.en: 3Then said the princes of the Philistines, What do these Hebrews here? And Achish said unto the princes of the Philistines, Is not this David, the servant of Saul the king of Israel, which hath been with me these days, or these years, and I have found no fault in him since he fell unto me unto this day?
29.lv:
3

Tad filistiešu prinči sacīja, Ko šie ebreji šeit dara? Un Ahišs sacīja filistiešu prinčiem, Vai šis nav Dāvids, Israēla ķēniņa Saula, kalps, kas ir bijis ar mani šīs dienas jeb šos gadus, un es neesmu atradis viņā nekādas vainas, kopš viņš krita uz mani līdz šai dienai?

29.en: 4And the princes of the Philistines were wroth with him; and the princes of the Philistines said unto him, Make this fellow return, that he may go again to his place which thou hast appointed him, and let him not go down with us to battle, lest in the battle he be an adversary to us: for wherewith should he reconcile himself unto his master? should it not be with the heads of these men?
29.lv: 4 Un filiestiešu prinči apskaitās uz viņu; un filistiešu prinči viņam sacīja, Liec šim cilvēkam atgriezties, lai viņš var iet atpakaļ uz savu vietu, ko tu viņam esi noteicis, un lai viņš nenoiet ar mums uz kauju, lai kaujā viņš nav mums pretinieks: jo ar ko viņš sevi samierinātu savam saimniekam? vai ne ar šo vīriešu galvām?

29.en: 5Is not this David, of whom they sang one to another in dances, saying, Saul slew his thousands, and David his ten thousands?
29.lv: 5 Vai šis nav Dāvids, par kuru viņi cits citam dziedāja dejās sacīdami, Sauls nokāva savus tūkstošus un Dāvids savus desmit tūkstošus?

29.en: 6Then Achish called David, and said unto him, Surely, as the LORD liveth, thou hast been upright, and thy going out and thy coming in with me in the host is good in my sight: for I have not found evil in thee since the day of thy coming unto me unto this day: nevertheless the lords favour thee not.
29.lv:
6

Tad Ahišs aicināja Dāvidu un viņam sacīja, Bez šaubām, kā tas KUNGS dzīvo, tu esi bijis taisns, un tava iziešana un ienākšana ar mani karapulkā ir laba manā skatienā: jo es tevī neesmu atradis ļaunumu kopš tavas nākšanas pie manis dienas līdz šai dienai; neraugoties uz to, kungiem pret tevi nav labvēlība.

29.en: 7Wherefore now return, and go in peace, that thou displease not the lords of the Philistines.
29.lv: 7 Tādēļ nu, atgriezies un ej mierā, lai tu neizraisi nepatiku filistiešu kungiem.

29.en: 8And David said unto Achish, But what have I done? and what hast thou found in thy servant so long as I have been with thee unto this day, that I may not go fight against the enemies of my lord the king?
29.lv:
8

Un Dāvids sacīja Ahišam, Bet ko es esmu izdarījis? un ko tu esi atradis savā kalpā tik ilgi, kamēr es esmu bijis pie tevis līdz šai dienai, lai es varu neiet cīnīties pret sava kunga ķēniņa ienaidniekiem?

29.en: 9And Achish answered and said to David, I know that thou art good in my sight, as an angel of God: notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, He shall not go up with us to the battle.
29.lv: 9 Un Ahišs atbildēja un sacīja Dāvidam, Es zinu, ka tu esi labs manā skatienā kā Dieva eņģelis; neskatoties uz to, filistiešu prinči ir sacījuši, Viņš nedosies ar mums kaujā.

29.en: 10Wherefore now rise up early in the morning with thy master's servants that are come with thee: and as soon as ye be up early in the morning, and have light, depart.
29.lv: 10 Tādēļ nu, celies agri no rīta kopā ar sava saimnieka kalpiem, kas ir nākuši kopā ar tevi: un, tiklīdz jūs no rīta esat cēlušies un ir gaisma, aizejiet.

29.en: 11So David and his men rose up early to depart in the morning, to return into the land of the Philistines. And the Philistines went up to Jezreel.
29.lv: 11 Tā Dāvids un viņa vīrieši cēlās agri no rīta aiziet, atgriezties filistiešu zemē. Un filistieši devās uz Jezreēlu.

30.en: 1And it came to pass, when David and his men were come to Ziklag on the third day, that the Amalekites had invaded the south, and Ziklag, and smitten Ziklag, and burned it with fire;
30.lv: 1 Un notika, kad Dāvids un viņa vīrieši trešajā dienā bija nākuši uz Ciklāgu, ka amalekieši bija iebrukuši dienvidos un Ciklāgā un situši Ciklāgu, un sadedzinājuši to ar uguni;

30.en: 2And had taken the women captives, that were therein: they slew not any, either great or small, but carried them away, and went on their way.
30.lv: 2 Un sievietes, kas tur bija, viņi bija ņēmuši par gūsteknēm: viņi nenokāva ne lielu, ne mazu, bet aizveda tos prom un aizgāja.

30.en: 3So David and his men came to the city, and, behold, it was burned with fire; and their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, were taken captives.
30.lv:
3

Tā Dāvids un viņa vīrieši nāca pilsētā, un, lūk, tā bija sadedzināta ar uguni; un viņu sievas, un viņu dēli, un viņu meitas bija ņemti par gūstekņiem.

30.en: 4Then David and the people that were with him lifted up their voice and wept, until they had no more power to weep.
30.lv: 4 Tad Dāvids un ļaudis, kas bija ar viņu, pacēla savu balsi un raudāja, līdz viņiem vairs nebija spēka raudāt.

30.en: 5And David's two wives were taken captives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
30.lv: 5 Un abas Dāvida sievas tika ņemtas par gūsteknēm, jezreēliete Ahinoāma un karmelieša Nabāla sieva Abigaila.

30.en: 6And David was greatly distressed; for the people spake of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David encouraged himself in the LORD his God.
30.lv: 6 Un Dāvids bija ļoti nospiests; jo ļaudis runāja par viņa nomētāšanu ar akmeņiem, jo ​​visas ļaužu dvēseles bija noskumušas, ikvienam par saviem dēliem un par savām meitām: bet Dāvids uzmundrināja sevi tai KUNGĀ, savā Dievā.

30.en: 7And David said to Abiathar the priest, Ahimelech's son, I pray thee, bring me hither the ephod. And Abiathar brought thither the ephod to David.
30.lv: 7 Un Dāvids sacīja priesterim Abjatāram, Ahimeleha dēlam, Es tevi lūdzu, atnes man šurp efodu. Un Abjatārs turp atnesa Dāvidam efodu.

30.en: 8And David enquired at the LORD, saying, Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Pursue: for thou shalt surely overtake them, and without fail recover all.
30.lv: 8 Un Dāvids jautāja pie tā KUNGA sacīdams, Vai man būs vajāt šo karaspēku? vai es viņus panākšu? Un viņš tam atbildēja, Vajā: jo tu viņus bez šaubām panāksi un katrā ziņā visu atgūsi.

30.en: 9So David went, he and the six hundred men that were with him, and came to the brook Besor, where those that were left behind stayed.
30.lv: 9 Tad Dāvids gāja, viņš un sešsimt vīrieši, kas bija ar viņu, un nāca pie Besora strauta, kur apstājās tie, kas bija atstāti aizmugurē.

30.en: 10But David pursued, he and four hundred men: for two hundred abode behind, which were so faint that they could not go over the brook Besor.
30.lv: 10 Bet Dāvids vajāja, viņš un četrsimt vīriešu: jo divi simti palika aizmugurē, kas bija tik noguruši, ka tie nevarēja pāriet Besora strautam.

30.en: 11And they found an Egyptian in the field, and brought him to David, and gave him bread, and he did eat; and they made him drink water;
30.lv:
11

Un viņi atrada ēģiptieti laukā un atveda viņu pie Dāvida, un deva viņam maizi, un viņš ēda; un tie lika viņam dzert ūdeni;

30.en: 12And they gave him a piece of a cake of figs, and two clusters of raisins: and when he had eaten, his spirit came again to him: for he had eaten no bread, nor drunk any water, three days and three nights.
30.lv: 12 Un tie viņam deva vīģu plāceņa gabalu un divus rozīņu ķekarus: un, kad viņš bija ēdis, viņa gars nāca atpakaļ pie viņa: jo viņš nebija ēdis maizi, ne dzēris ūdeni trīs dienas un trīs naktis.

30.en: 13And David said unto him, To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou? And he said, I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days agone I fell sick.
30.lv: 13 Un Dāvids viņam sacīja, Kam tu piederi? un no kurienes tu esi? Un viņš sacīja, Es esmu jauneklis no Ēģiptes, amalekieša kalps; un mans saimnieks mani atstāja, tāpēc ka pirms trīs dienām es saslimu.

30.en: 14We made an invasion upon the south of the Cherethites, and upon the coast which belongeth to Judah, and upon the south of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire.
30.lv: 14 Mēs veicām iebrukumu uz dienvidiem no keretiešiem un uz apkārni, kas pieder Jūdam, un uz dienvidiem no Kaleba; un mēs sadedzinājām Ciklāgu ar uguni.

30.en: 15And David said to him, Canst thou bring me down to this company? And he said, Swear unto me by God, that thou wilt neither kill me, nor deliver me into the hands of my master, and I will bring thee down to this company.
30.lv: 15 Un Dāvids viņam sacīja, Vai tu vari mani atvest pie šīs grupas? Un viņš sacīja, Zvēri man pie Dieva, ka tu mani ne nogalināsi, ne mani nodosi mana saimnieka rokās, un es tevi novedīšu pie šīs grupas.

30.en: 16And when he had brought him down, behold, they were spread abroad upon all the earth, eating and drinking, and dancing, because of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines, and out of the land of Judah.
30.lv:
16

Un, kad tas viņu bija novedis, lūk, tie bija izpletušies pa visu zemi, ēzdami un dzerdami, un dejodami visa lielā laupījuma dēļ, ko viņi bija ņēmuši no filistiešu zemes un no Jūdas zemes.

30.en: 17And David smote them from the twilight even unto the evening of the next day: and there escaped not a man of them, save four hundred young men, which rode upon camels, and fled.
30.lv: 17 Un Dāvids tos sita no krēslas līdz pat nākamās dienas vakaram: un neviens no viņiem neizbēga, kā vien četrsimt jaunekļi, kas jāja uz kamieļiem un bēga.

30.en: 18And David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away: and David rescued his two wives.
30.lv: 18 Un Dāvids atguva visu, ko amalekieši bija aizveduši: un Dāvids izglāba abas savas sievas.

30.en: 19And there was nothing lacking to them, neither small nor great, neither sons nor daughters, neither spoil, nor any thing that they had taken to them: David recovered all.
30.lv: 19 Un viņiem netrūka nekā, nedz maza, ne liela, nedz dēlu, ne meitu, nedz laupījuma, ne kaut kas, ko viņi bija viņiem ņēmuši: Dāvids visu atguva.

30.en: 20And David took all the flocks and the herds, which they drave before those other cattle, and said, This is David's spoil.
30.lv: 20 Un Dāvids ņēma visus liellopus un sīklopus, ko tie dzina pa priekšu tiem citiem lopiem, un sacīja, Šis ir Dāvida laupījums.

30.en: 21And David came to the two hundred men, which were so faint that they could not follow David, whom they had made also to abide at the brook Besor: and they went forth to meet David, and to meet the people that were with him: and when David came near to the people, he saluted them.
30.lv:
21

Un Dāvids nāca pie tiem divsimt vīriešiem, kas bija tik noguruši, ka tie nevarēja sekot Dāvidam, kuriem viņi bija likuši palikt pie Besora strauta: un tie izgāja satikt Dāvidu un satikt ļaudis, kas bija kopā ar viņu: un, kad Dāvids nāca tuvu ļaudīm, viņš tos sveicināja.

30.en: 22Then answered all the wicked men and men of Belial, of those that went with David, and said, Because they went not with us, we will not give them ought of the spoil that we have recovered, save to every man his wife and his children, that they may lead them away, and depart.
30.lv: 22 Tad visi nelietīgie un Beliala vīrieši no tiem, kas gāja ar Dāvidu, atbildēja un sacīja, Tāpēc ka viņi negāja mums līdzi, mēs viņiem nedosim neko no laupījuma, ko mēs esam atguvuši, kā vien ikvienam savu sievu un savus bērnus, lai tie tos var aizvest un aiziet.

30.en: 23Then said David, Ye shall not do so, my brethren, with that which the LORD hath given us, who hath preserved us, and delivered the company that came against us into our hand.
30.lv: 23 Tad Dāvids sacīja, Jums tā nebūs darīt, mani brāļi, ar to, ko tas KUNGS mums ir devis, kas mūs ir pasaudzējis un nodevis mūsu rokā grupu, kas nāca pret mums.

30.en: 24For who will hearken unto you in this matter? but as his part is that goeth down to the battle, so shall his part be that tarrieth by the stuff: they shall part alike.
30.lv: 24 Jo kurš jūs uzklausīs šajā lietā? bet kāda ir tā daļa, kas noiet kaujā, tāda būs tā daļa, kas uzkavējas pie lietām: tie dalīs vienādi.

30.en: 25And it was so from that day forward, that he made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel unto this day.
30.lv: 25 Un tas tā bija no tās dienas uz priekšu, ka viņš to darīja par statūtu un rīkojumu Israēlam līdz šai dienai.

30.en: 26And when David came to Ziklag, he sent of the spoil unto the elders of Judah, even to his friends, saying, Behold a present for you of the spoil of the enemies of the LORD;
30.lv:
26

Un, kad Dāvids nāca uz Ciklāgu, viņš sūtīja no laupījuma Jūdas vecajiem, proti, saviem draugiem sacīdams, Lūk, dāvana jums no tā KUNGA ienaidnieku laupījuma;

30.en: 27To them which were in Bethel, and to them which were in south Ramoth, and to them which were in Jattir,
30.lv: 27 Tiem, kas bija Bētelē, un tiem, kas bija dienvidos Ramotā, un tiem, kas bija Jatirā,

30.en: 28And to them which were in Aroer, and to them which were in Siphmoth, and to them which were in Eshtemoa,
30.lv: 28 Un tiem, kas bija Aroērā, un tiem, kas bija Sifmotā, un tiem, kas bija Eštemoā,

30.en: 29And to them which were in Rachal, and to them which were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, and to them which were in the cities of the Kenites,
30.lv: 29 Un tiem, kas bija Rahalā, un tiem, kas bija jerahmeeliešu pilsētās, un tiem, kas bija keniešu pilsētās,

30.en: 30And to them which were in Hormah, and to them which were in Chorashan, and to them which were in Athach,
30.lv: 30 Un tiem, kas bija Hormā, un tiem, kas bija Korašānā, un tiem, kas bija Atahā,

30.en: 31And to them which were in Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men were wont to haunt.
30.lv: 31 Un tiem, kas bija Hebronā, un visās vietās, kur Dāvids pats un viņa vīrieši mēdza uzturēties.

31.en: 1Now the Philistines fought against Israel: and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
31.lv: 1 Tad nu filistieši cīnījās pret Israēlu: un Israēla vīrieši bēga no filistiešu priekšas un krita nokauti Gilboas kalnā.

31.en: 2And the Philistines followed hard upon Saul and upon his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchishua, Saul's sons.
31.lv: 2 Un filistieši cieši sekoja Saulam un viņa dēliem; un filistieši nokāva Jonatānu un Abinadābu, un Malkišuju, Saula dēlus.

31.en: 3And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers hit him; and he was sore wounded of the archers.
31.lv: 3 Un cīņa bija gauža pret Saulu, un strēlnieki viņu sita; un viņš tika gauži ievainots no strēlniekiem.

31.en: 4Then said Saul unto his armourbearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and abuse me. But his armourbearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword, and fell upon it.
31.lv: 4 Tad Sauls sacīja savam bruņu nesējam, Velc savu zobenu un caurdur mani ar to; lai šie neapgraizītie nenāk un necaurdur mani, un neizturas pret mani ļaunprātīgi. Bet viņa bruņu nesējs to negribēja; jo viņš gauži baidījās. Tāpēc Sauls ņēma zobenu un krita uz tā.

31.en: 5And when his armourbearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise upon his sword, and died with him.
31.lv: 5 Un, kad viņa bruņu nesējs redzēja, ka Sauls bija miris, viņš tāpat krita uz sava zobena un nomira kopā ar viņu.

31.en: 6So Saul died, and his three sons, and his armourbearer, and all his men, that same day together.
31.lv: 6 Tā tajā pašā dienā nomira Sauls un viņa trīs dēli, un viņa bruņu nesējs, un visi viņa vīrieši kopā.

31.en: 7And when the men of Israel that were on the other side of the valley, and they that were on the other side Jordan, saw that the men of Israel fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook the cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
31.lv:
7

Kad Israēla vīrieši, kas bija otrpus ielejai, un tie, kas bija otrpus Jordānai, redzēja, ka Israēla vīrieši bēga un ka Sauls un viņa dēli bija miruši, viņi pameta pilsētas un bēga; un filistieši nāca un tajās mājoja.

31.en: 8And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his three sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
31.lv: 8 Un notika nākamajā dienā, kad filistieši nāca izģērbt nokautos, ka viņi atrada Saulu un viņa trīs dēlus kritušus Gilboas kalnā.

31.en: 9And they cut off his head, and stripped off his armour, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to publish it in the house of their idols, and among the people.
31.lv: 9 Un viņi nogrieza viņam galvu un novilka viņa bruņas, un sūtīja uz apkārtējo filistiešu zemi, to pavēstīt viņu elku namā un starp ļaudīm.

31.en: 10And they put his armour in the house of Ashtaroth: and they fastened his body to the wall of Bethshan.
31.lv: 10 Un viņi lika viņa bruņas Aštarotas namā: un tie piestiprināja viņa ķermeni pie Betšaānas mūra.

31.en: 11And when the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead heard of that which the Philistines had done to Saul;
31.lv:
11

Un, kad Jabešgilādas iedzīvotāji dzirdēja par to, ko filistieši bija darījuši Saulam;

31.en: 12All the valiant men arose, and went all night, and took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Bethshan, and came to Jabesh, and burnt them there.
31.lv: 12 Visi varonīgie cēlās un gāja visu nakti, un ņēma Saula un viņa dēlu ķermeņus no Betšaānas mūra, un nāca uz Jabešu, un tur tos sadedzināja.

31.en: 13And they took their bones, and buried them under a tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
31.lv: 13 Un viņi ņēma viņu kaulus un tos apbedīja zem koka Jabešā un gavēja septiņas dienas.
